description: Update the specified channel. You can edit if MediaPackage sends ingest or egress access logs to the CloudWatch log group, if content will be encrypted, the description on a channel, and your channel's policy settings. You can't edit the name of the channel or CloudFront distribution details. Any edits you make that impact the video output may not be reflected for a few minutes.

parameters.name: ChannelGroupName
parameters.description: The name that describes the channel group. The name is the primary identifier for the channel group, and must be unique for your account in the AWS Region.

parameters.name: ChannelName
parameters.description: The name that describes the channel. The name is the primary identifier for the channel, and must be unique for your account in the AWS Region and channel group.

parameters.name: InputSwitchConfiguration
parameters.description: The configuration for input switching based on the media quality confidence score (MQCS) as provided from AWS Elemental MediaLive. This setting is valid only when InputType is CMAF. MQCSInputSwitching (boolean) --- When true, AWS Elemental MediaPackage performs input switching based on the MQCS. Default is true. This setting is valid only when InputType is CMAF.

nested_params.name: MQCSInputSwitching
nested_params.description: When true, AWS Elemental MediaPackage performs input switching based on the MQCS. Default is true. This setting is valid only when InputType is CMAF.

parameters.name: OutputHeaderConfiguration
parameters.description: The settings for what common media server data (CMSD) headers AWS Elemental MediaPackage includes in responses to the CDN. This setting is valid only when InputType is CMAF. PublishMQCS (boolean) --- When true, AWS Elemental MediaPackage includes the MQCS in responses to the CDN. This setting is valid only when InputType is CMAF.

nested_params.name: PublishMQCS
nested_params.description: When true, AWS Elemental MediaPackage includes the MQCS in responses to the CDN. This setting is valid only when InputType is CMAF.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the resource.

nested_items.name: ChannelName
nested_items.description: The name that describes the channel. The name is the primary identifier for the channel, and must be unique for your account in the AWS Region and channel group.

nested_items.name: ChannelGroupName
nested_items.description: The name that describes the channel group. The name is the primary identifier for the channel group, and must be unique for your account in the AWS Region.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time the channel was created.

nested_items.name: ModifiedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time the channel was modified.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The system-generated unique identifier for the IngestEndpoint.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The ingest domain URL where the source stream should be sent.

nested_items.name: InputType
nested_items.description: The input type will be an immutable field which will be used to define whether the channel will allow CMAF ingest or HLS ingest. If unprovided, it will default to HLS to preserve current behavior.

nested_items.type: which defines M3U8 manifests and TS segments
nested_items.description: HLS - The HLS streaming specification (which defines M3U8 manifests and TS segments).

nested_items.type: which defines CMAF segments with optional DASH manifests
nested_items.description: CMAF - The DASH-IF CMAF Ingest specification (which defines CMAF segments with optional DASH manifests).

nested_items.name: ETag
nested_items.description: The current Entity Tag (ETag) associated with this resource. The entity tag can be used to safely make concurrent updates to the resource.

nested_items.name: InputSwitchConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration for input switching based on the media quality confidence score (MQCS) as provided from AWS Elemental MediaLive. This setting is valid only when InputType is CMAF.

nested_items.name: MQCSInputSwitching
nested_items.description: When true, AWS Elemental MediaPackage performs input switching based on the MQCS. Default is true. This setting is valid only when InputType is CMAF.

nested_items.name: OutputHeaderConfiguration
nested_items.description: The settings for what common media server data (CMSD) headers AWS Elemental MediaPackage includes in responses to the CDN. This setting is valid only when InputType is CMAF.

nested_items.name: PublishMQCS
nested_items.description: When true, AWS Elemental MediaPackage includes the MQCS in responses to the CDN. This setting is valid only when InputType is CMAF.
